channel.title: ICRC - International Committee of the Red Cross
channel.description: ICRC - International Committee of the Red Cross

image.title: ICRC - International Committee of the Red Cross

item.title: Mexico: Restoring family links following floods
item.description: Geneva (ICRC) – In the wake of recent flooding in Mexico's southern Tabasco state, tens of thousands of people have been temporarily housed in shelters all across the disaster-affected area.

item.title: Iraq: ICRC facilitates return home of Iranian national
item.description: Geneva (ICRC) – The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) today facilitated the repatriation of an Iranian national released in Iraq.

item.title: Gaza and West Bank – ICRC Bulletin No. 27 / 2007
item.description: Latest report on ICRC activities in the field

item.title: Sudan: Emergency aid for civilians around Haskanita
item.description: Geneva (ICRC) – The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) has distributed relief supplies to 5,560 people who fled their homes to the countryside and villages around Haskanita, North Darfur, following the clashes that took place on 29-30 September.

item.title: Chad: Joint action by the ICRC, UNHCR and UNICEF in behalf of the 103 Abéché children
item.description: Abéché – 1.11.2007 – Since the events of 25 October that led to the arrest of members of the “Children Rescue/Arche de Zoé” organization, the staff and partner organizations of the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and the United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF) have been working to meet the needs of the 103 children currently living in the Abéché orphanage.

item.title: Russian Federation: ICRC carries out final relief distribution in Chechnya
item.description: Geneva/Grozny (ICRC) – As the humanitarian situation in the Chechen Republic continues to improve, the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) is carrying out its final distribution of food and other aid.

item.title: Sri Lanka: ICRC unable to transport mortal remains
item.description: Colombo (ICRC) – The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) was unable to transfer the remains of Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) personnel killed last Monday in Anuradhapura.

item.title: ICRC activities in Israel and the occupied and autonomous territories: September 2007
item.description: In Israel and the occupied and autonomous territories, the ICRC works towards ensuring the faithful application of international humanitarian law (IHL), especially the Fourth Geneva Convention, which protects civilians during armed conflict and occupation - Also available in Hebrew.

item.title: Tenth anniversary of the mine ban Convention - from mines to cluster munitions
item.description: Mobilising to stop weapons which keep on killing. Notes from the presentation by Peter Herby, Head of the ICRC Arms Unit, Oslo, 18 September 2007

item.title: Afghanistan: ICRC activities January to September 2007
item.description: Afghanistan is one of the ICRC's largest operations worldwide with more than 1,200 national and expatriate staff involved in a wide range of activities on behalf of people affected by conflict. The following is an update of ICRC activities for the period January to September 2007.
